segments.text: wow , the duck looks so delicious . Should we order it , Rick ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: the chef is going to slice it into thin pieces . There will be around one hundred and twenty pieces of both skin and meat for each .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I see . The chef is so skillful with his knife .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: absolutely . It is said that they serve 3,000 ducks every day .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: incredible . By the way , what are these in the plates ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: oh , they are pancakes , hollowed sesame buns , scallions , cucumbers and oisin sauce . I will show you how to make one .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: thank you . I couldn't wait any longer to have a taste .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Just roll it up and have a bite , Amy .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: oh , it's terrific . I love the floor . Can you tell me how it was prepared ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: certainly . First , a Beijing duck is specially selected . After it is cleaned and dressed , it will be roasted in an open oven . Only wood of fruit trees are used to fuel the fire to give the duck a unique
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: it sounds really complicated . No wonder it tastes so great .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , Amy , please have some more .
segments.speaker: S2
